ACT
177
Local jurisdiction
The court in whose territory the testator had his residence at the time of death (probate court) has local jurisdiction for probate proceedings.
If the testator was not domiciled in the Republic of Croatia at the time of his death, the court in whose territory the testator was domiciled at that time is competent for probate proceedings.
If at the time of death the decedent had neither residence nor place of residence in the Republic of Croatia, the local competent court is the court in whose territory the majority of his estate is located in the Republic of Croatia.
If no part of the estate is located in the Republic of Croatia, the local court is competent according to the place where the testator is registered in the register of citizens.
In addition to the probate court, temporary measures for securing the estate can be ordered by the court in whose territory the testator died and the court in whose territory the testator's property is located.
When the Croatian court is not competent for probate proceedings, the jurisdiction of the Croatian court that is authorized to carry out certain actions is determined according to the provisions of paragraphs 1 to 5 of this article.
